lines.gurmukhi: crn srin ghy inj Gir mY invws Awsw mnsw Qkq Anq n DwveI
lines.transliteration_english: Charan Sarani Gahay Nij Ghari Mai Nivaasa , Aasaa Manasaa Dakat Anat N Dhaavaee ?

Shabad OS B.translation: In the refuge of a True Guru, a devoted Sikh resides in higher spiritual plane. All his expectations and desires vanish and his mind does not waver any more.

lines.gurmukhi: drsn mwqR Awn iDAwn mY rhq hoie ismrn Awn ismrn ibsrwveI
lines.transliteration_english: Darasan Maatr Aan Dhiaan Mai Rahat Hoi , Simaran Aan Simaran Bisaraavaee ?

Shabad OS B.translation: By the glimpse of True Guru, a devoted Sikh seeks not audience with anyone else. He rids himself of all other remembrances.

lines.gurmukhi: sbd suriq moin bRq kau pRwpiq hoie pRym rs AkQ kQw n kih AwveI
lines.transliteration_english: Sabad Surati Moni Brat Kau Praapati Hoi , Praym Ras Akad Kadaa N Kahi Aavaee ?

Shabad OS B.translation: By engrossing his mind in the divine word (of Guru), he becomes bereft of all other thoughts. (He gives up all other futile talks). Thus his love for his Lord is beyond description.

lines.gurmukhi: ikMcq ktwC kiRpw prm inDwn dwn prmdBuq giq Aiq ibsmwveI ]105]
lines.transliteration_english: Kinchat Kataachh Kripaa Param Nidhaan Daana , Paramadabhout Gati Ati Bisamaavaee ?105?

Shabad OS B.translation: By a momentary glimpse of the True Guru, one attains invaluable treasure of His name. The state of such a person is amazing and a cause of surprise for the beholder. (105)
